verbs.description: [ARG0: roseville mom] [V: demands] [ARG1: crossing guards] [ARGM-TMP: after daughter was hit while riding bike if you 're viewing on the abc10 app tap here for multimedia lisa clark 7-year - old daughter gracelyn was riding her bike on tuesday sept 25 when she was hit by a car off woodcreek oaks boulevard and zinnia way gracelyn was pinned underneath the vehicle there were people surrounded everywhere and i saw my daughter underneath a car and she was trapped and i went to someone right away clark said describing seeing her daughter pinned by the car gracelyn walked away from the accident with a broken nose 10 stitches and no bike to get to school the next day] [C-ARG1: rob baquera] a spokesperson for the roseville police department said gracelyn was fortunate in wearing personal protection devices like a helmet which likely helped prevent any serious injuries however while she encouraging parents and children to wear their helmets clark wants more to be done clark is gathering other parents to get more crossing guards in their neighborhood i have a lot of community involvement clark said every parent wants there to be crossing guards rebekah glass another mother in the neighborhood agrees the only difference would be some crossing guards there because that big glass said that a person with authority and a sign and it would eliminate confusion for drivers as well as the kids gracelyn mom wo n't let her ride a bike to school until there is a crossing guard and gracelyn is n't opposed i want crossing guards here [C-ARG1: cause if i] ever ride my bike to school again i do n't want to get hit again gracelyn said i want crossing guards to tell them when to not go lisa is expected to speak at an assembly at blue oaks elementary school at 9 a m thursday oct 25 continue the conversation with ananda on facebook rob baquera lisa clark gracelyn clark roseville roseville police department blue oaks elementary school

roseville mom demands [V: crossing] [ARG0: guards] after daughter was hit while riding bike if you 're viewing on the abc10 app tap here for multimedia lisa clark 7-year - old daughter gracelyn was riding her bike on tuesday sept 25 when she was hit by a car off woodcreek oaks boulevard and zinnia way gracelyn was pinned underneath the vehicle there were people surrounded everywhere and i saw my daughter underneath a car and she was trapped and i went to someone right away clark said describing seeing her daughter pinned by the car gracelyn walked away from the accident with a broken nose 10 stitches and no bike to get to school the next day rob baquera a spokesperson for the roseville police department said gracelyn was fortunate in wearing personal protection devices like a helmet which likely helped prevent any serious injuries however while she encouraging parents and children to wear their helmets clark wants more to be done clark is gathering other parents to get more crossing guards in their neighborhood i have a lot of community involvement clark said every parent wants there to be crossing guards rebekah glass another mother in the neighborhood agrees the only difference would be some crossing guards there because that big glass said that a person with authority and a sign and it would eliminate confusion for drivers as well as the kids gracelyn mom wo n't let her ride a bike to school until there is a crossing guard and gracelyn is n't opposed i want crossing guards here cause if i ever ride my bike to school again i do n't want to get hit again gracelyn said i want crossing guards to tell them when to not go lisa is expected to speak at an assembly at blue oaks elementary school at 9 a m thursday oct 25 continue the conversation with ananda on facebook rob baquera lisa clark gracelyn clark roseville roseville police department blue oaks elementary school

roseville mom demands crossing guards after daughter [V: was] hit while riding bike if you 're viewing on the abc10 app tap here for multimedia lisa clark 7-year - old daughter gracelyn was riding her bike on tuesday sept 25 when she was hit by a car off woodcreek oaks boulevard and zinnia way gracelyn was pinned underneath the vehicle there were people surrounded everywhere and i saw my daughter underneath a car and she was trapped and i went to someone right away clark said describing seeing her daughter pinned by the car gracelyn walked away from the accident with a broken nose 10 stitches and no bike to get to school the next day rob baquera a spokesperson for the roseville police department said gracelyn was fortunate in wearing personal protection devices like a helmet which likely helped prevent any serious injuries however while she encouraging parents and children to wear their helmets clark wants more to be done clark is gathering other parents to get more crossing guards in their neighborhood i have a lot of community involvement clark said every parent wants there to be crossing guards rebekah glass another mother in the neighborhood agrees the only difference would be some crossing guards there because that big glass said that a person with authority and a sign and it would eliminate confusion for drivers as well as the kids gracelyn mom wo n't let her ride a bike to school until there is a crossing guard and gracelyn is n't opposed i want crossing guards here cause if i ever ride my bike to school again i do n't want to get hit again gracelyn said i want crossing guards to tell them when to not go lisa is expected to speak at an assembly at blue oaks elementary school at 9 a m thursday oct 25 continue the conversation with ananda on facebook rob baquera lisa clark gracelyn clark roseville roseville police department blue oaks elementary school
